Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Statuette
Description: A large statuette of the god Osiris, made from bronze. The god is in characteristic pose, standing and mummiform, clasping the crook and flagellum. The eyes are inlaid, lending a startling aspect to the figure, and there are traces of gilt on the crown and face. On the crown are slits for the insertion of horns and feathers to make up the atef-crown, now missing.
